headline: Local Briefs: 3-26-2022
sentences: The commission is comprised of the director of the Ohio Department of Development, the chancellor of the Ohio Department of Higher Education, the governor’s science and technology advisor, the chief investment officer of JobsOhio, and six regional business or research representatives and one public-at-large representative appointed by the governor.

Events will take place each Monday in April, starting with presentations about caregiving from Sara Chambers from Hospice of Northwest Ohio and Jessica Ricker from the Wood County Committee on Aging at Stony Ridge Branch Library on April 4.

Two ‘Simple Gifts’ concerts set
PERRYSBURG — St. Timothy’s Episcopal Church of Perrysburg Discovers Series presents a concert duo of two women playing 12 instruments on April 3 at 3 p.m. at the church, 871 E. Boundary St.

Community reads dives into caregiving and burnout
PEMBERVILLE — Join the Pemberville Public Library System’s 2022 Community Reads Program, featuring “Already Toast: Caregiving and Burnout in America” by Kate Washington.

This book is a memoir of the author’s struggle to care for her seriously ill husband, offering a revealing look at the role unpaid family caregivers play in a society that fails to provide them with structural support.

BGSU ensembles show canceled
PERRYSBURG — The Chamber Ensembles of Bowling Green State University previously scheduled to perform at St. Timothy’s Episcopal Church on Sunday has been canceled.

Rotary hears about downtown district
The Bowling Green Rotary Club guest speaker for Thursday is Tony Vetter, executive director of the Downtown Bowling Green Special Improvement District.
The commission is responsible for the allocation of funds appropriated by the Ohio General Assembly to support programs and activities associated with the Ohio Third Frontier.

Trustees vote on budget
LIME CITY — The Perrysburg Township will hold a special meeting on Thursday at 4 p.m. in the township meeting hall at 26609 Lime City Road.
Vetter will give an update on the mission to preserve and promote the special improvement district as the cultural, historic and business heart of the city.
The Luckey Area Library Movement and Friends of the Pemberville and Stony Ridge Libraries have sponsored a limited number of paperback copies to give away.
Linda Littleton and Karen Hirshon switch among fiddle, mandolin, banjo, guitar, recorders, bowed psaltery, hammered dulcimer, guitar and percussion.
Drawing on an impressive variety of ethnic folk styles, this award-winning duo plays everything from lively Irish jigs to Balkan dance music.
The concert will be repeated on the Bowling Green State University campus April 4 at 4 p.m. at Kelly Hall, 1012 Moore Musical Arts Center.
Performing Romanian, Klezmer, Greek, Scottish, Scandinavian, Appalachian, and more music than one afternoon can imagine.
The trustees will consider and vote on approval of the township permanent budget for calendar year 2022.
The Community Reads will wrap up on April 25 with a virtual author visit at Pemberville Public Library.
